title: Drawing, first half 17th century
medium: Pen and brown ink, red chalk, brush and gray wash on laid paper
signed: Signed in brown ink, lower margin: Pietro Novelli il Monrealese
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower right, in modern hand: Monrealese
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. & Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Two figures, a man on the left looking at a woman on the right whose mouth is open, as putti fly overhead.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, first half 17th century.
first half 17th century. Pen and brown ink, red chalk, brush and gray wash on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-97.
